overview.summary: Due to a specified dipole, the potential on the outer sphere of a four layer spherical volume conductor is computed.

description.p: The potentials on the outer sphere are calculated analytically at the electrode positions. The spherical volume consists of four layers (skalp, skull, cerebrospinal fluid, brain). Every layer can have different radial and tangential conductivities. The dipole has to be in the innermost sphere.
The port takes a handle of the electrode positions where the potential has to be computed.

The port takes a handle to the matrix that is 1-by-6 in size, containing parameters of 1 dipole. The first three columns are dipole position. The last three colums are dipole moments. If the dipole lies outside the innermost sphere, the log window creates a warning message.
The port takes a matrix containing the radii for scalp, skull, cerebrospinal fluid and the brain.
The port takes a matrix containing radial and tangential conductivities of all 4 layers.
The initial field is populated with potential values.

net.title: Dipole In Anisotropic Spheres
net.p: Use of module DipoleInAnisoSpheres is shown in . The network computes potentials on the surface of a sphere.

section.title: Inputs
section.p: DipoleInAnisoSpheres receives sphere model parameters from module . Electrode positions are recieved, as a field, on the first yellow port. Sphere radii parameters are recieved, as a matrix, on the first blue port. Conductivity data are recieved, as a matrix, on the second blue port.
Dipole field data are recieved on the second yellow port from module .

section.title: Outputs
section.p: DipoleInAnisoSpheres generate a potential field (electrode positions and corresponding potential values, which is then transmitted on its sole output port to modules and .
The potential field and dipole are rendered by module from scene graph data produced by modules and .
